channel.title: Posts on Jeffrey Cyphers Wright
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Jeffrey Cyphers Wright

item.title: Later Than You Think
item.description: released September 15, 2018 JCW – Guitar, harmonica, vocals, sound effects Lesley James Stephenson – Fiddle, guitar, vocals Erica Weiss – Fiddle, guitar, vocals Joseph Stephenson – Drum Later Than You Think by Jeffrey Cyphers Wright Mark Ari – Editor and Producer Dan Pike – Associate Producer Cover Art by Jeffrey Cyphers Wright Support artists producers of indie music and spoken word. Buy the Digital album for as little as $8.

item.title: 2019 Events
item.description: Saturday, January 19, 2019 7-9pm HOWLELLUJAH! A Magazine Launch for LiVE MAG! Issue #15 Wright and Associate Editor Ilka Scobie, invite you to join us and our feature performers in celebrating Live Mag! Issue #15. This will be a night to howl about at the legendary Howl Happening space. Featuring Bob Holman, Helixx Armegeddon, special guest Andrei Codrescu, and more!

item.title: 2018 Events
item.description: December 15, 6pm Jeff is guest poet in an evening of song and poetry at Cornelia Street Cafe. December 3, 7:30 pm Freedom Writers at La MaMa, the LiVE MAG! #15 launch event, features a super mix of literary legends and must-see up and comers MC’d by JCW with host William Electric Black. Take home the new issue, free with admission. October 2, 7pm LiVE MAG! presents issue #15, Preview of a Reveiew at KGB Lit Bar.

item.title: NOLA Poetry Festival 18
item.description: JCW 2008 First cover of LiVE MAG! announcing the pre-festival reading at the landmark NOLA Tree of Life. View from LiVE MAG!s table in the Small Press Book Fair at this year's festival. Panel: Jenna Spagnolo, John Goslee, Elle Aviv Newton, Jeff. Photo by Alison Ross The Community and Collaboration panel Sunday 4⁄22 comrised Goslee, Spagnolo and Newton from Poets Reading the News, and LiVE MAG’s JCW.

item.title: JCW URLs
item.description: Live Mag Jeff’s 14 issue, 40 page art and poetry mag Empty Mirror Collages Poets Reading the News Jeff’s illustrated political poetry The Key Ceremony Community Garden Event, associated art and performance. Clubhouse on East 13th Don Yorty’s video of a preview reading, at Sidewalk Cafe, of Jeff’s play Clubhouse on East 13th featuring Wright, Hillary Keel, Debra Jenks, Surge, Jane LeCroy, Anders Goldfarb, and Debra Drexler

item.title: Triller
item.description: Triller 2016 marker on handmade paper 8 x 8 in.

item.description: Jeff reading at Cafe Istanbul. Photo by Alison Roos
